Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough of the kitchen multiple dry and wet food items were expired and multiple food items were not stored properly.
Correction Narrative: Supervisor conducted a physical follow-up at the operation and a full walkthrough was conducted. Supervisor inspected the kitchen checking both dry and wet foods and no concerns with the expiration dates nor food storage were observed.  It was observed that the operation adds the received date on their foods items, which is different from the expiration date, and this is not a concern nor risk to children as none of food items were expired nor spoiled.  Supervisor also observed all refrigerators/freezers to be accurately reading at the time of the inspection. Supervisor reviewed the opening-closing checklist and interviewed the staff regarding the new process that the operation has implemented, and no concerns were noted.  Staff uses FoodSafety.org to ensure they are following the correct protocols and staff has access to the website at all times and it's reviewed to ensure they are correctly following the chart based on the food storage.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care were able to access razors from secured operation locations.
Correction Narrative: In person follow-up conducted and staff interviewed confirmed receiving training on admission policy changes.

Deficiency Narrative: 11 of the 16 fire drills reviewed did not have required information.
Correction Narrative: Operation advised that they have reviewed the recent fire drill documentation and identified several instances where information was either incomplete or unclear. In response, they provided re-education to the Plant Operations Manager, who is in charge of the drills, to ensure these issues are addressed moving forward. Administrator will also meet with Plant Operations Manager to review all fire drill logs for accuracy and completeness during their weekly meetings.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff member engaged in a verbal confrontation with a child in care.
Correction Narrative: Email received from operation that employee involved in the incident was terminated. Additional information was received on 2/6/25 that the incident was discussed with all caregivers in the weekly meeting regarding professionalism, tone, language, etc. Meeting agenda notes were provided.

Deficiency Narrative: Incident reports were missing some information regarding time and date and names of adults involved.
Correction Narrative:
An email on 8/22/24 with operation was received stating that a designated staff will now conduct audits and review the annual summary log weekly. 

Clarification email received from operation on 8/26/24 that Activities Coordinator, who reports to the Treatment Director, will be completing the weekly audit of the operation's annual summary log. The operations log consists of EBI, unauthorized absences, 2991's, and triggered reviews.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of two child admission assessments did not have a professional level service provider signature or date.
Correction Narrative: In person follow-up confirmed that internal audit was being completed weekly by treatment director.

Deficiency Narrative: 2 of the 3 plans reviewed did not have confirmation that required parties were notified of the date the service plans would be completed and did not give those parties an opportunity to respond
Correction Narrative: In person follow-up confirmed that an internal checklist was created to ensure that notification of meeting were sent to all parties timely. Checklist is completed by Case Manager. Treatment Director will confirm checklist is completed.

Deficiency Narrative: Two child files were reviewed. The children's files did not include all necessary information within the file at the time of admission.
Correction Narrative: Operation recompleted the admission assessments for the files observed and a retraining was conducted with staff on 7/8/24 to ensure that all admission assessments are completed accurately.

Deficiency Narrative: Two child files were reviewed. The orientation information provided to the children within seven days of admission did not include all information regarding operation policies.
Correction Narrative: Email received from operation on 7/19/24 advising that Residents and guardians are provided with copies of all required policies in their admission handbook. Operation has a resident version in a more easily understandable format, and one for guardians. Therapists meet with residents to go over the documentation in the handbook to ensure residents understand the material. Residents as well as guardians sign an acknowledgment that they have received all the required policies which are filed in resident files. The operation provided a digital copy of their orientation booklet that is provided to both the parent and the child on 9/3/24 and the acknowledgement form that they sign that they were reviewed and received.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of two child placement agreements were reviewed, and neither were signed by the child's parent/managing conservator.
Correction Narrative: In person follow-up confirmed that internal checklist was created by operation to ensure that document is signed and correctly scanned and placed into residents file. Case Manager completed the checklist and Treatment Director verifies the document.

Deficiency Narrative: Two child files were reviewed, there were multiple items that were missing within each child's admission assessment.
Correction Narrative: Operation recompleted the admission assessments for the files observed and a retraining was conducted with staff on 7/8/24 to ensure that all admission assessments are completed accurately.

Deficiency Narrative: Residential Child Care Regulation observed the operation's emergency evacuation posters to be without documentation of a designated outside meeting point.
Correction Narrative: In person follow-up confirmed that new signs were posted at operation.

Deficiency Narrative: 2 of the 3 plans reviewed did not specify who was included or present in developing the service plans
Correction Narrative: In person follow-up confirmed that an internal checklist was created to ensure that required signatures were present. Checklist is completed by Case Manager. Treatment Director will confirm checklist is completed.

Deficiency Narrative: 2 of the 3 service plans reviewed were unclear as to who received a copy of the plan
Correction Narrative: In person follow-up confirmed that service plans for existing residents are being conducted at two per week until all residents have completed service plans however new residents will be completed as required.

Deficiency Narrative: Residential Child Care Regulation observed a care giver's training record to be without 40 hours of on-the-job training. The explanation note read that the care giver had this at a previous operation.
Correction Narrative: In person follow-up confirmed that caregiver completed required hours. In person follow-up also confirmed that operation created a checklist of what all personnel files and employees need to meet requirements to include caregiver experience hours.

Deficiency Narrative: Child in care on 1:1 supervision swallowed a foreign object which required medical treatment such as x-rays as this could result in an unhealthy condition of the body and mind.
Correction Narrative: In person follow-up conducted and 2 staff were interviewed who confirmed that additional training was received.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care cheeked medication and took more than the prescribed amount.
Correction Narrative: Operation provided additional medication administration training to employees and operation posted in-service training and medication administration reminders in the medical station. In person follow-up confirmed that signs were posted in the medication room.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation utilized a drive sharing service to transport a child who was accompanied by staff from the hospital back to the operation.
Correction Narrative: Inspector received email from operation with compliance plan stating that operation had received a van from sister location to use and have transitioned all necessary materials from one van to another.  The operation reported they are no longer utilizing the rideshare service and are only using the borrowed van or staff member's vehicles for transport while they are in the process of searching for a new vehicle for purchase.

Deficiency Narrative: An employee file had reference checks; however, it was not documented if the references were professional or personal.
Correction Narrative: Inspector received email from operation with compliance plan stating that the staff file in question has been updated to reflect which type of reference check was completed.  Operation states that in future to prevent this citation from re-occurring they will credit an audit checklist to be completed by HR to ensure which type of reference check was completed.

Deficiency Narrative: Two serious incident reports did not have the operation's phone number.
Correction Narrative: Inspector received compliance plan from operation informing that modifications to serious incident report were completed to add the operations phone number. A request was also made to operations IT update serious incident report form to include phone number on online form.

Deficiency Narrative: An employee file did not have documented the number of attempts made to contact the employees' former employers or the employers refusal to provide information. In the result area of contact it stated "NA"
Correction Narrative: Inspector received email from operation with compliance plan stating that the staff file in question has been updated to reflect all necessary reference completed reference checks.  Operation states that in future to prevent this citation from re-occurring they will credit an audit checklist to be completed by HR to ensure the number of attempts are marked for contacting previous employers.

Deficiency Narrative: During an inspection, 1 of 5 staff files reflected the notarized affidavit was provided and signed but was not completed in the exception area.Â
Correction Narrative: Inspector received email from Administrator with completed notarized affidavit.  Administrator reported in an effort to prevent this from occurring again they have developed a staff file audit, which reflects minimum standards. HR will complete the initial audit on each file. We then have a standing meeting on the first business day of the month where directors will complete a second audit on their employe files, utilizing the minimum standards checklist. The checklist will contain signature lines and dates to indicate who completed the audits and when. This double audit system will reduce the number of oversights and increase accountability significantly.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, record review of serious incident report reflected it did not contain all the required sections of a serious incident report to include: physical address, telephone number, names of adults involved and/or their role to child, witness information, interventions made during and after incident.
Correction Narrative: Inspector received email from Administrator who informed the operation would be adopting Form 2991 for serious incident reporting. It will be uploaded in our medical record system for ease of use. Blank copies will also be stored in the Annual Summary Log in the Serious Incident Log tab.

Deficiency Narrative: During an inspection at the operation, it was found an employee did not have a completed initial background check.
Correction Narrative: Background check submitted on 1/11/2024. As of 1/16/2024 background is still pending. Extension granted for 1/26/2024.

Deficiency Narrative: During an inspection, record review for 1 of 5 staff files reflected only one reference was contacted instead of two.
Correction Narrative: Inspector received email from Administrator with competed reference checks (2). Administrator also reported in an effort to prevent this issue from reoccurring, they have developed a staff file audit, which reflects minimum standards. HR will complete the initial audit on each file. We then have a standing meeting on the first business day of the month where directors will complete a second audit on their employe files, utilizing the minimum standards checklist. The checklist will contain signature lines and dates to indicate who completed the audits and when. This double audit system will reduce the number of oversights and increase accountability significantly.

Deficiency Narrative: During walk through of operation it was observed that fire extinguishers had not been inspected for the month of October 2023. Operation staff admitted no monthly check was completed on during the month of October 2023.
Correction Narrative: Inspector received an email from administrator with compliance plan and attached fire extinguisher inspection log that will be used each month to track when fire extinguishers will checked by the 15th of each month.
